responses: (Defendent McGee) promised a patient (Plaintiff Hawkins) a 100% good hand after a skin graft but the operation resulted in a hairy palm instead.The court ruled that damages should be the difference in value between the promised hand and the actual hand plus incidental damages focusing on expectation damages to put the plaintiff in the position had the contract been fulfilled
